prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the following location and orientation: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4887, 0.0] Create the first face of the 2D sketch by drawing a line from the point (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). Draw a second line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0272). Next, draw a line from this point to (0.0, 0.0272). Finally, close the loop by drawing a line from (0.0, 0.0272) back to the start at (0.0, 0.0). This forms the first face of the prism. Create the second face of the 2D sketch using the same process, but with different dimensions: 1. Draw a line from (0.0492, 0.1537) to (0.7008, 0.1537). 2. Draw a line from (0.7008, 0.1537) to (0.7008, 0.1808). 3. Draw a line from (0.7008, 0.1808) to (0.0492, 0.1808). 4. Close the loop by drawing a line from (0.0492, 0.1808) back to the start at (0.0492, 0.1537). With both faces drawn, scale the entire 2D sketch by 0.75 times using the sketch scaling parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system established earlier. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.4887 units to create the 3D model. Part 2 Instructions Create a set of three cylindrical objects, each with a flat top and bottom, arranged in a triangular pattern with varying heights. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the following location and orientation: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1035, 0.4751, 0.1537] Create the first face of the 2D sketch by drawing a circle with a center at (0.0272, 0.0272) and a radius of 0.0272. Create the second face of the 2D sketch using the same process, but with a different center coordinate: (0.0272, 0.4344) Repeat these steps for the remaining two circles with center coordinates at (0.5159, 0.0272) and (0.5159, 0.4344). With all four circles drawn, scale the entire 2D sketch by 0.543 times using the sketch scaling parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system established earlier. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.1385 units to create the 3D model.</description>
